1* While the round table sessions were very valuable as they were handled, I feel that,
as an individual, I might have benefited more if part of each evening had been de¬
voted to smaller discussion groups around each of the speakers of the day* I real¬
ize that in a case or two, the speakers would not have had much of a discussion
group but feel that this could be handled by having the participants turn in cards
signifying their preference; then, if the groups did not divide along natural lines
of interest, a combined discussion could be held or perhaps two speakers could go
into the seme group*
When I first received the detailed schedule of cessions and even when I was in atten¬
dance, X felt that the evening sessions made a rather long hard dsy* However, in
retrospect, I feel that the long hours were well worthwhile and much better than
the other possibilities of lengthening the workshop or making it less comprehen¬
sive*
2e In attending the workshop, I expected to receive information that would be of help
to me in the final planning, installation, maintenance, and operation of our TV
installation* While much of the workshop was devoted to operating problems, this
has bean of help to ms in the final planning of our set-up. I had several informal
talks with the WKAR personnel about their installation and also with the other work¬
shop participants* I expect to reap greater benefits when we get into actual opera¬
tion*
3o In a five-day workshop having such a broad scope and consisting of 2$ participants,
it is difficult to imagine how much actual operating could be worked in* If the
scope of the workshop were considerably narrowed and if there were fewer partici¬
pants, then perhaps it could be more of a workshop* I feel that for the time in¬
vested, the conference pays greater dividencTsT
Since I was one of the participants who needed the actual operating more than most,
I am attempting to solve this individually as much as possible by working part-
time in a local commercial TV station*
Up At the workshop X expressed, and heard expressed, the desire on the part of some
of the participants to receive virtually word-for-word transcripts of some of the
talks* I heard various participants indicate that if the NAEB did not have the
time, funds, etc* to make the transcripts, that they had the facilities at their
institutions* These transcripts would be valuable, not only to workshop partici¬
pants, but also to other educational TV engineers* Vty greatest personal need is
for the papers on lighting* I would be glad to help in having these transcribed
and duplicated if the NAEB does not plan to do so.
So Continue the technical tips, Engineering Newsletter, etc*
John McClamrock
